ORSF summary of univariate information

Source: R/orsf_summary.R
orsf_summarize_uni.Rd

ORSF summary of univariate information

Usage

orsf_summarize_uni(
  object,
  n_variables = NULL,
  pred_horizon = NULL,
  risk = TRUE
)

Arguments

object

(aorsf) an oblique random survival forest (ORSF; see orsf).

n_variables

(integer) how many variables should be summarized? Setting this input to a lower number will improve computation time.

pred_horizon

(double) a single time or a vector of times indicating the prediction horizon. Predicted risk or survival values will indicate the probability of having an event or surviving from baseline to the prediction horizon, respectively. All pred_horizon values must not exceed the maximum follow-up time in object's training data. Also, pred_horizon values must be entered in ascending order.

risk

(logical) if TRUE, predicted risk is returned. If FALSE, predicted survival (i.e., 1-risk) is returned.

Value

an object of class 'aorsf_summary'

Examples


object <- orsf(pbc_orsf, Surv(time, status) ~ . - id)

orsf_summarize_uni(object, n_variables = 3)
#> 
#> -- age (VI Rank: 1) ----------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>   41.5 0.2735842 0.1308125 0.04362369 0.4605086
#>   49.7 0.2986489 0.1636944 0.05316093 0.5106441
#>   56.6 0.3269604 0.2107489 0.06860803 0.5560048
#> 
#> -- bili (VI Rank: 2) ---------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>   0.80 0.2309728 0.1139594 0.04893229 0.3707935
#>   1.40 0.2488877 0.1333815 0.06060192 0.3950234
#>   3.52 0.3681158 0.2759321 0.16420638 0.5507161
#> 
#> -- ascites (VI Rank: 3) ------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>      0 0.2944583 0.1606852 0.05640793 0.5116135
#>      1 0.4723861 0.3922525 0.26926659 0.6613870
#> 
#>  Predicted risk at time t = 1788 for top 3 predictors
